meanings.definition: The state or quality of being rusty.
meanings.sent1: The old bike showed signs of rustiness on its handlebars.
meanings.sent2: The rustiness on the metal gate made it difficult to open.
meanings.sent3: The rustiness of the old key made it look like a tiny orange forest.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned car exuded a sense of rustiness that matched its neglected appearance.
meanings.sent5: The rustiness of the iron chain glinted in the sunlight, reminding me of the passage of time.

meanings.definition: The condition of being affected by rust.
meanings.sent1: The rustiness of the pipes caused a leak in the basement.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge was closed due to the severe rustiness of its structure.
meanings.sent3: The rustiness on the doorknob made it look like it had a tiny orange sweater.
meanings.sent4: The rustiness of the anchor symbolized the ship's long history at sea.
meanings.sent5: The rustiness of the metal fence hinted at years of exposure to the elements.

meanings.definition: A lack of freshness or vigor.
meanings.sent1: The rustiness of the bread made it unappetizing to eat.
meanings.sent2: The rustiness of the team's performance was evident in their defeat.
meanings.sent3: The rustiness of the joke fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent4: The rustiness of the old engine prevented it from starting smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The rustiness of the paintbrush resulted in streaks on the canvas.
